intro: Aneilema acuminatum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which come in shades of violet, pink, and white, are often used in horticulture for ornamental purposes. Aneilema acuminatum thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
